value.string:
\n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n

CMFOpenflow Demo

\n \n

\n Create a new Issue
\n Worklist
\n Reports
\n Spreadsheet data\n (Open it with your favorite spreadsheet)
\n chat_session_19nov2002.txt\n

\n \n

\n \n
\n \n

**** BEGIN LOGGING AT Tue Nov 19 21:00:50 2002
 
 Nov 19 21:00:50 -->	You are now talking on #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:01:02 <vds>	hi T-Mu^
 Nov 19 21:03:37 -->	zwark (~robert@193.154.188.120) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:04:49 -->	GogoBD (~georg@212186108137.14.wu-wien.teleweb.at) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:05:36 <GogoBD>	Hi, there!
 Nov 19 21:08:00 <T-Mu^>	hello
 Nov 19 21:08:16 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to GogoBD
 Nov 19 21:08:38 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to vds
 Nov 19 21:08:51 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to zwark
 Nov 19 21:09:28 <vds>	Hi GogoBD
 Nov 19 21:09:34 <vds>	hi zwark
 Nov 19 21:17:09 -->	alastair (~Burt@mastiff.dfki.uni-sb.de) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:21:49 <GogoBD>	Hi, Vincenzo and everybody!
 Nov 19 21:22:07 <vds>	Hi GogoBD
 Nov 19 21:22:46 <GogoBD>	Greetings from Robert and Phil, they asked me to tell you that they might be *DELAYED*;
 Nov 19 21:23:09 <GogoBD>	Robert told me that he'll make it until 2200, Phil doesn't know if he can make it at all,
 Nov 19 21:23:30 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 21:23:42 <GogoBD>	Robert hat to deal with a flat tire and a water supply in his appartment that couldn't be turned off...
 Nov 19 21:23:56 <GogoBD>	But he tries to join!
 Nov 19 21:26:32 <GogoBD>	Both asked me to be here until one of them will show up, so I can save the chat after it has finished.
 Nov 19 21:28:39 ---	vds gives channel operator status to alastair
 Nov 19 21:29:19 <vds>	ok I will leave the example app online so they will be able to see it if they like
 Nov 19 21:29:43 <GogoBD>	That's a very good idea, thank you!
 Nov 19 21:38:13 <T-Mu^>	I'm going to be idle from now, just logging the chat here as well. That's because I don't like lurking at the office much longer as it's soon 11pm here. Looking forward to gain some insight into the topic afterwards however.
 Nov 19 21:38:57 <T-Mu^>	vds: I'd appreciate the post-chat availability of the example app too :)
 Nov 19 21:41:18 <T-Mu^>	Will dash now. Have a great session everyone and TTYL!
 Nov 19 21:41:46 <vds>	thanks
 Nov 19 21:41:47 <vds>	:)
 Nov 19 21:45:40 <--	zwark (~robert@193.154.188.120) has left #cmfopenflow ("Client Exiting")
 Nov 19 21:46:49 -->	robert_ (~robert@193.154.188.120) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:46:57 ---	robert_ is now known as zwark
 Nov 19 21:47:50 <vds>	if you want to take a look at the example while wainting http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking
 Nov 19 21:47:57 -->	paolo (~wazzawazz@peste.php3.it) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:48:22 <paolo>	hi guys.
 Nov 19 21:48:33 <vds>	login customer passwd customer
 Nov 19 21:49:41 <vds>	you have access to the management interface if you want to take a look at the code
 Nov 19 21:50:12 <--	zwark has quit (Client Quit)
 Nov 19 21:51:01 <T-Mu^>	is it possible to have a .zexp file or sth similar?
 Nov 19 21:52:03 -->	zwark (~robert@193.154.188.120) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:52:12 <zwark>	hi guys
 Nov 19 21:52:17 -->	ilBestio (ilBestio@host77-102.pool21345.interbusiness.it) has joined #CMFopenflow
 Nov 19 21:52:25 <zwark>	tire fixed, water stopped ;)
 Nov 19 21:52:27 <vds>	sure I can put it on the web I send an email to all of you when done
 Nov 19 21:52:37 <vds>	hi zwark
 Nov 19 21:52:41 <vds>	hi ilBestio
 Nov 19 21:52:42 <zwark>	hi enzo
 Nov 19 21:52:51 <ilBestio>	hi all
 Nov 19 21:52:56 <vds>	ilBestio: please introduce yourself :)
 Nov 19 21:53:42 <T-Mu^>	vds: great! thanks
 Nov 19 21:54:12 -->	limi (~count@59.80-202-174.nextgentel.com) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:54:16 ---	vds gives channel operator status to paolo
 Nov 19 21:54:17 <ilBestio>	sure: my real name is francesco and i have the honor to work with vds
 Nov 19 21:54:27 <alastair>	Ciao enzo!
 Nov 19 21:54:28 <ilBestio>	:)
 Nov 19 21:54:32 <limi>	hello, all
 Nov 19 21:55:00 <vds>	hi all 
 Nov 19 21:55:00 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to zwark
 Nov 19 21:55:00 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to limi
 Nov 19 21:55:13 ---	vds gives channel operator status to ilBestio
 Nov 19 21:55:35 <paolo>	thanks vds.
 Nov 19 21:57:44 <vds>	let me know if someone of you have trouble logging in or something else with the web site
 Nov 19 21:57:48 -->	srichter (~kopeteuse@host-130-64-83-100.medford.tufts.edu) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:57:48 <vds>	please
 Nov 19 21:58:23 -->	jack-e (nobody@pD9EBF83C.dip.t-dialin.net) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:58:32 ---	vds has changed the topic to: Example URL http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking
 Nov 19 21:58:44 -->	runyaga (~runyaga@cs671084-157.houston.rr.com) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 21:58:51 <runyaga>	goto http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking ?
 Nov 19 21:59:07 <runyaga>	did I miss it?
 Nov 19 22:00:06 <runyaga>	? hello?
 Nov 19 22:00:35 <GogoBD>	Hi, Alan! You are joust in time!
 Nov 19 22:00:41 <runyaga>	EXCELLENT!
 Nov 19 22:00:43 <runyaga>	where do I go?
 Nov 19 22:00:57 <GogoBD>	The URL you quoted before :-)
 Nov 19 22:01:23 <vds>	can we start ?
 Nov 19 22:01:33 <ilBestio>	oui
 Nov 19 22:01:42 <vds>	any problem with the web site ?
 Nov 19 22:01:54 ---	T-Mu^ gives channel operator status to runyaga
 Nov 19 22:02:10 <runyaga>	looks fine to me
 Nov 19 22:02:42 ---	vds gives channel operator status to jack-e
 Nov 19 22:02:46 <zwark>	lets start
 Nov 19 22:02:47 ---	vds gives channel operator status to srichter
 Nov 19 22:02:50 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 22:02:53 <runyaga>	do i need to join?
 Nov 19 22:03:09 <vds>	login customer
 Nov 19 22:03:11 <runyaga>	or jsut wait?
 Nov 19 22:03:18 <vds>	passwd customer
 Nov 19 22:03:30 <runyaga>	k
 Nov 19 22:03:38 ---	vds has changed the topic to: Example URL http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking login: customer passwd: customer
 Nov 19 22:03:57 <vds>	ok lets start
 Nov 19 22:04:22 <vds>	we`ve implemented a very simple issues tracking system
 Nov 19 22:04:53 <vds>	just to explain how we develop workflow
 Nov 19 22:05:01 <--	jack-e has quit (Excess Flood)
 Nov 19 22:05:16 <vds>	apps using an activity based wf
 Nov 19 22:05:49 <vds>	as you can see in the picture we have 5 activities
 Nov 19 22:06:09 <vds>	and 4 roles
 Nov 19 22:06:31 <vds>	a customer can submit an issues
 Nov 19 22:07:14 <vds>	it can be releated to software or hardware problems or undefined
 Nov 19 22:07:59 <vds>	if the customer leaves undefined the issue type a supervisor can route the workflow in the correct direction
 Nov 19 22:08:09 -->	zz (~foo@h24-80-80-137.vn.shawcable.net) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 22:09:12 ---	runyaga gives channel operator status to zz
 Nov 19 22:09:24 <vds>	supporters will solve the problem and at the end an automatic app will send an email to the customer with the details of the closed issue
 Nov 19 22:09:32 <vds>	any question so far ?
 Nov 19 22:09:41 -->	zwork (~phil@62.218.23.177) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 22:09:57 <runyaga>	no
 Nov 19 22:10:13 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 22:10:42 -->	ev_ (~chatzilla@ARennes-303-1-11-2.abo.wanadoo.fr) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 22:10:45 <vds>	if you are logged in as customer you can try to insert a new issue
 Nov 19 22:11:07 <ev_>	bleh, i'm confused, i've been sitting in this channel for 15 minutes :( sorry
 Nov 19 22:11:32 <vds>	click on the Create new issue link
 Nov 19 22:11:49 <vds>	hi Paul
 Nov 19 22:12:10 <ev_>	howdy, sorry
 Nov 19 22:12:25 <zwork>	hi vds,paul,folks
 Nov 19 22:12:31 zwark zwork Nov 19 22:12:33 <vds>	hi zwork
 Nov 19 22:13:11 <vds>	we`ve started few minutes ago point your browsers to the url written in the topic please 
 Nov 19 22:13:26 *	zwork already did
 Nov 19 22:13:35 <ev_>	ok
 Nov 19 22:14:17 <vds>	did some one chose and area different from undefined ?
 Nov 19 22:14:23 <runyaga>	yes
 Nov 19 22:14:38 *	zwark not, choosed software
 Nov 19 22:14:51 <runyaga>	i choose softare
 Nov 19 22:14:57 *	alastair chose 'undefined'.
 Nov 19 22:15:06 <ilBestio>	i chosed undef
 Nov 19 22:15:10 <ev_>	i chose software
 Nov 19 22:15:15 <ev_>	asked for a login
 Nov 19 22:15:18 <GogoBD>	I used undefined.
 Nov 19 22:15:21 <runyaga>	ev_: customer/customer
 Nov 19 22:15:39 <vds>	ok now log out and log in again as supportersw supportersw
 Nov 19 22:15:51 <ev_>	tks
 Nov 19 22:16:25 <vds>	then click on Worklist
 Nov 19 22:17:28 <ev_>	ok
 Nov 19 22:17:33 <zwark>	k
 Nov 19 22:17:49 <vds>	that`s the worklist from which every task is started by the actors
 Nov 19 22:17:53 <GogoBD>	where ist "Worklist" ?
 Nov 19 22:18:10 <vds>	is a link on the page 
 Nov 19 22:18:32 <vds>	under Submit new issue
 Nov 19 22:18:49 <ev_>	later it will be an portal_action, right?
 Nov 19 22:18:55 *	zwark slashes GogoBD with a big Zope manual
 Nov 19 22:18:56 <alastair>	I have taken the liberty to becomne supervisor. I have assigned my issue. Hope nobody minds.
 Nov 19 22:19:05 <ev_>	:)
 Nov 19 22:19:14 <vds>	alastair: no :)
 Nov 19 22:19:14 <GogoBD>	I got it, thanks!
 Nov 19 22:19:30 <alastair>	Oops! It was my issue.
 Nov 19 22:20:35 <vds>	what ?
 Nov 19 22:21:32 <vds>	ok can some one of you choose a workitem and start to work on it ?
 Nov 19 22:22:06 <zwark>	you mean start application or self assign
 Nov 19 22:22:09 <zwark>	?
 Nov 19 22:22:29 <vds>	self assign and then start or just start
 Nov 19 22:23:25 <vds>	wow lots of issues solved
 Nov 19 22:23:41 <ilBestio>	:)
 Nov 19 22:23:56 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 22:24:33 <vds>	when you solved the issues an automatic email has been sent to the customer but we can see that later
 Nov 19 22:24:51 <vds>	I know that now it looks very stupid :)
 Nov 19 22:25:00 <vds>	not so much to see right ?
 Nov 19 22:25:20 <vds>	lets see something that you may start to appreciate
 Nov 19 22:25:35 <vds>	go back to the main page please
 Nov 19 22:25:58 <vds>	and click on reports
 Nov 19 22:26:02 <--	srichter has quit ("Using Kopete IRC Plugin")
 Nov 19 22:26:25 ---	zwark gives channel operator status to zwork
 Nov 19 22:26:25 ---	zwark gives channel operator status to ev_
 Nov 19 22:26:42 <alastair>	vds: I get connection refused, when I click on reports.
 Nov 19 22:26:46 <zwark>	timed out
 Nov 19 22:26:52 <runyaga>	timed out for me as well
 Nov 19 22:26:56 <paolo>	http://192.168.145.7:9673/CMFOpenflowTest/portal_openflow/OFReportModule
 Nov 19 22:26:57 <runyaga>	is the CPU at 100%? ;-)
 Nov 19 22:27:01 <paolo>	problem on link
 Nov 19 22:27:25 <vds>	me to
 Nov 19 22:27:28 <vds>	me too
 Nov 19 22:27:30 <vds>	sorry
 Nov 19 22:27:33 <runyaga>	tiemd out
 Nov 19 22:27:44 <vds>	it seems that the connection on the server is down
 Nov 19 22:27:55 <GogoBD>	grr
 Nov 19 22:27:56 <runyaga>	zope still running?
 Nov 19 22:28:19 <zwark>	other links are working
 Nov 19 22:28:37 <vds>	I`m checking
 Nov 19 22:29:31 <vds>	work for me now
 Nov 19 22:29:39 <ev_>	moi aussi
 Nov 19 22:29:42 <ilBestio>	ok
 Nov 19 22:30:18 *	zwark got again timeout
 Nov 19 22:30:28 <vds>	due to the bad weather we`re having lots of problems with our internet connections I`ve been off line all day long today, sorry
 Nov 19 22:30:35 *	alastair got connection refused.
 Nov 19 22:31:01 <vds>	are you still logged in ?
 Nov 19 22:31:38 <alastair>	As supportersw
 Nov 19 22:31:46 *	zwark is connected
 Nov 19 22:32:09 <GogoBD>	Other lInks, like "Undo" work for me...
 Nov 19 22:32:11 <ev_>	i tried again, no luck
 Nov 19 22:32:20 <vds>	who can access it and who cannot please ?
 Nov 19 22:32:28 <ev_>	yep, and Worklist works
 Nov 19 22:32:41 *	zwark can't connect to "Reports"
 Nov 19 22:32:42 <ev_>	(as opposed to Notworklist)
 Nov 19 22:33:10 <ilBestio>	i can only if i log with my proper account on www.reflab.it (manager)
 Nov 19 22:33:45 <paolo>	http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/portal_openflow/OFReportModule
 Nov 19 22:33:50 <paolo>	this works
 Nov 19 22:34:06 <ev_>	yes
 Nov 19 22:34:12 ---	zz is now known as zz|work
 Nov 19 22:34:22 <zwark>	for me paolos link works
 Nov 19 22:34:28 <zwark>	looks cool ;)
 Nov 19 22:34:41 <ev_>	but what does it mean?
 Nov 19 22:34:49 <vds>	I don`t understand what`s happened
 Nov 19 22:35:26 *	zwark spended a day at consultants. I don't ask what it means anymore ;)
 Nov 19 22:35:48 <alastair>	paolo: That URL worked for me. Very swish!
 Nov 19 22:35:49 <vds>	is a demo of how online statistic reports can be created 
 Nov 19 22:36:13 <vds>	dns problems ? it`s strange ?!!
 Nov 19 22:36:39 <runyaga>	so this shows how long it took for a activity to complete?
 Nov 19 22:37:22 <zwark>	vds: please explain the graphs 
 Nov 19 22:37:34 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 22:38:05 <vds>	the pie graph is the distribution in time between the different activities
 Nov 19 22:38:50 <ilBestio>	report link fixed :)
 Nov 19 22:39:05 <alastair>	What is "active time"?
 Nov 19 22:39:28 <vds>	the second one is how much time of "real" work the actors spended on the process instance
 Nov 19 22:39:55 <vds>	the third is how long the process instances take to be comleted
 Nov 19 22:40:13 -->	jack-e (nobody@pD9EBF83C.dip.t-dialin.net) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 22:40:41 <vds>	and the last one is the distribution in 20 slots, just to reduce the range for the graph
 Nov 19 22:41:16 <vds>	it is just an example of what can be done 
 Nov 19 22:41:43 <ilBestio>	ie instance duration = how much time the company will take to solve the customer's problem
 Nov 19 22:41:44 <vds>	beacause everything is just a python script that makes a query
 Nov 19 22:41:44 <alastair>	So active time is the sum of time taken to from selecting an item from the worklist and submitting the "query" to complete the task?
 Nov 19 22:41:47 <zwark>	vds: what is needed for the creation? PIL IMAGEMACKIG?
 Nov 19 22:42:01 <runyaga>	GDChart?
 Nov 19 22:42:11 <vds>	ZGDChart
 Nov 19 22:42:19 <zwark>	ok
 Nov 19 22:42:47 <vds>	but if you open your openoffice or excel and open the following url with it
 Nov 19 22:43:03 <vds>	http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking/portal_openflow/OFReportModule/instance_active_time_report.csv
 Nov 19 22:43:23 <vds>	just open and write it as file name to open
 Nov 19 22:43:38 <runyaga>	so.. we are interested in "How long it takes for someone to 'accept' the task to actually sign off that its complete' ?
 Nov 19 22:44:13 <vds>	you can import the data in your spreadsheet and create the graph you prefer
 Nov 19 22:44:19 <GogoBD>	Ciao, folks, I need to drop out now, thank you very much for the Presentation, Vincenzo, I'll try the Application later.
 Nov 19 22:44:33 <vds>	GogoBD: bye
 Nov 19 22:44:45 <runyaga>	I guess I need to work with it more.. I dont quite understand 
 Nov 19 22:45:03 <runyaga>	the metrics are "how long it took for activities to be completed?"
 Nov 19 22:45:07 <zwark>	GogoBD: this means lower salary next month. :)
 Nov 19 22:45:17 *	runyaga grins
 Nov 19 22:45:29 *	zwork nods
 Nov 19 22:45:43 <vds>	runyaga: it is just an example we can look at the code later and you can see what happens :)
 Nov 19 22:45:56 <vds>	ok can we proceed ?
 Nov 19 22:46:01 <runyaga>	yes
 Nov 19 22:46:09 <vds>	does your spreadsheet works fine ?
 Nov 19 22:46:13 <ev_>	yes
 Nov 19 22:46:14 <vds>	any problems >
 Nov 19 22:46:15 <vds>	?
 Nov 19 22:46:32 <ev_>	i'm on a mac, don't have no stinking spreadsheet :)
 Nov 19 22:46:39 <alastair>	Yes, works in StarOffice.
 Nov 19 22:46:42 <vds>	ev_: :)
 Nov 19 22:46:56 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 22:47:13 <vds>	any question ?
 Nov 19 22:47:26 <zwark>	please go on
 Nov 19 22:47:47 <vds>	so lets look at the code
 Nov 19 22:48:00 <vds>	customer is also manager 
 Nov 19 22:48:17 <vds>	you can access the manage interface of the portal
 Nov 19 22:49:01 <vds>	go to portal_openflow
 Nov 19 22:49:28 <vds>	you can see now something that looks like a worklist
 Nov 19 22:49:57 <vds>	it`s the manager worklist you can controll evry process instance from here
 Nov 19 22:50:18 <vds>	for each workitem you can :
 Nov 19 22:50:29 <vds>	1) start to work on it
 Nov 19 22:50:59 <vds>	2) assign the workitem to someone else (push)
 Nov 19 22:51:26 <vds>	3)send it out of the standard flow
 Nov 19 22:51:36 <ev_>	sorry, i'm on the phone
 Nov 19 22:51:55 ---	vds gives channel operator status to jack-e
 Nov 19 22:51:57 <zwark>	vds: I can't find my issue. it was customer acme
 Nov 19 22:52:15 <vds>	some one have probably solved it
 Nov 19 22:52:32 <vds>	you`ll find it in the preocess instance tab
 Nov 19 22:52:33 <zwark>	it was me, yes. but where is it ?
 Nov 19 22:52:58 <vds>	ok lets` go to the preocess instance tab
 Nov 19 22:53:35 <vds>	you can fine there each process instance and its status
 Nov 19 22:54:03 <vds>	click on one of them and you`ll see everything that happend with that instance
 Nov 19 22:54:44 <vds>	a complete one will show you a table with every single workitem and its history
 Nov 19 22:54:58 <zwark>	but not the issue and it's solution. maybe I'm blind 
 Nov 19 22:55:05 <vds>	a running one will also gives you the possibility to wor on some workitem
 Nov 19 22:55:33 zwark zwork Nov 19 22:55:36 <vds>	zwark: http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/portal_openflow/acme1037741300.68/
 Nov 19 22:55:44 <vds>	that`s your one
 Nov 19 22:56:32 <zwark>	vds: I wanted to review the issue text and the solution track also
 Nov 19 22:56:39 <zwark>	solution text
 Nov 19 22:57:43 <zwark>	vds: you know what I mean ?
 Nov 19 22:57:45 <vds>	take a look at the properties tab of the instance
 Nov 19 22:58:02 <zwark>	thanks
 Nov 19 22:58:02 <vds>	yes just a SLOW connection
 Nov 19 22:58:31 <vds>	any questions so far ?
 Nov 19 22:59:03 <zwark>	not for me. but they will come, be sure
 Nov 19 22:59:14 <vds>	ok lets see how we implemented that
 Nov 19 22:59:52 *	runyaga likes the icons
 Nov 19 23:00:01 <runyaga>	j/k
 Nov 19 23:00:05 <vds>	go back to the portal_openflow page
 Nov 19 23:00:08 <runyaga>	what next?
 Nov 19 23:00:09 <runyaga>	ok
 Nov 19 23:00:19 <vds>	and choose process definitions
 Nov 19 23:00:46 <vds>	there is just one click on it
 Nov 19 23:01:09 <vds>	you can see two mai tables
 Nov 19 23:01:11 <vds>	main
 Nov 19 23:01:23 <zwark>	"add process definition" ?
 Nov 19 23:01:31 <vds>	the first one shows activities
 Nov 19 23:01:38 <vds>	no IssuesTracking
 Nov 19 23:01:54 <vds>	and the other one the transitions
 Nov 19 23:01:56 <zwark>	ok
 Nov 19 23:02:30 <vds>	a process definitions is defined as something like a petri net
 Nov 19 23:02:49 <vds>	activities are linked together by transitions
 Nov 19 23:03:02 <vds>	and transitions can have conditions or not
 Nov 19 23:03:12 <vds>	we can have parallel path
 Nov 19 23:03:32 <vds>	subflow (sync or asynch)
 Nov 19 23:03:44 <vds>	and exclusive path
 Nov 19 23:04:07 <vds>	and also loops
 Nov 19 23:04:29 <vds>	an activity can the following attributes
 Nov 19 23:05:57 <--	runyaga has quit ("Client Exiting")
 Nov 19 23:05:58 <vds>	kind: dummy (does nothing but helps in routing) standard or subflow (call the execution of a different process definitions)
 Nov 19 23:06:28 <vds>	xor/and split
 Nov 19 23:07:03 <vds>	xor split start an exclusive path - and split starts a parallel path
 Nov 19 23:07:12 <vds>	xor/and join
 Nov 19 23:07:32 <vds>	xor join closes an exclusive path - and closes a parallel path
 Nov 19 23:07:50 <vds>	uhmm questions ?
 Nov 19 23:07:55 <vds>	too boring ?
 Nov 19 23:07:59 <vds>	too stupid ?
 Nov 19 23:08:15 <vds>	too much confusion ?
 Nov 19 23:08:35 <paolo>	it's interesting for me.
 Nov 19 23:08:36 *	zwark cools smoking head
 Nov 19 23:08:40 <jack-e>	vds: how can i see the app for issue-solving ??
 Nov 19 23:08:45 -->	runyaga (~runyaga@cs671084-157.houston.rr.com) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 23:08:50 ---	zwark gives channel operator status to runyaga
 Nov 19 23:09:11 <jack-e>	i missed parts of your demo
 Nov 19 23:09:18 <jack-e>	most actually :)
 Nov 19 23:09:39 <zwark>	<vds> xor/and split
 Nov 19 23:09:39 <zwark>	<vds> xor split start an exclusive path - and split starts a parallel path
 Nov 19 23:09:39 <zwark>	<vds> xor/and join
 Nov 19 23:09:39 <zwark>	<vds> xor join closes an exclusive path - and closes a parallel path
 Nov 19 23:09:41 <zwark>	<vds> uhmm questions ?
 Nov 19 23:09:43 <zwark>	<vds> too boring ?
 Nov 19 23:09:45 <zwark>	<vds> too stupid ?
 Nov 19 23:09:46 <zwark>	<vds> too much confusion ?
 Nov 19 23:09:50 <zwark>	sorry
 Nov 19 23:09:53 <vds>	jack-e: manage interface of http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking
 Nov 19 23:10:08 <alastair>	vds: it's pretty clear to me. I have not worked out how the splits and joins are specified though.
 Nov 19 23:10:29 *	zwark has also a problem with this
 Nov 19 23:10:46 <vds>	uhm the first activity of our example is a xor split
 Nov 19 23:11:21 <vds>	because it check what type 
 Nov 19 23:11:32 <vds>	of issue i was submitting
 Nov 19 23:11:56 <vds>	so the routing machine move the flow in the correct direction automatically
 Nov 19 23:12:13 <alastair>	And the conditins for the following transitions must be mutually exclusive.
 Nov 19 23:12:31 <vds>	and the last activity is a xor join that close the split
 Nov 19 23:12:51 <vds>	alastair: the first true pass
 Nov 19 23:14:22 <vds>	we cannot see here an and split example but you can immagine that, in our example
 Nov 19 23:14:35 *	zwark got it
 Nov 19 23:15:06 <vds>	the system instead of choose where to route the flow
 Nov 19 23:15:13 *	zwark hopes he has it also tommorow:)

 Nov 19 23:21:27 <vds>	ok lets go back to the Roles tab of portal_openflow
 Nov 19 23:22:09 <vds>	that`s a very bad interface I know
 Nov 19 23:22:51 <paolo>	no, why? ;)
 Nov 19 23:22:53 <vds>	you can find here the mapping between zope roles and what they can do inside the workflow engine
 Nov 19 23:23:43 <vds>	I have to say that we have two assignement paradigms for assign tasks to an actor
 Nov 19 23:24:09 <vds>	pull: actors have a pool of tasks (workitems) to accomplish
 Nov 19 23:24:58 <vds>	push: someone with a specific role can assign tasks to actors for a specific activity
 Nov 19 23:25:13 <vds>	here you can define thaat roles
 Nov 19 23:25:25 <vds>	and what they can do
 Nov 19 23:25:46 <vds>	brb
 Nov 19 23:28:06 <vds>	ok
 Nov 19 23:29:12 <vds>	when we create wf apps we spend the lage amout of time tring to understand the how the process definitons is
 Nov 19 23:30:01 <vds>	after that model it with openflow is not very complicated (once you became a little familiar)
 Nov 19 23:30:56 <vds>	then writing the applications used to accomplish the tasks is usually very easy
 Nov 19 23:31:21 <vds>	the intercation with the workflow engine looks always the same
 Nov 19 23:31:58 <vds>	lets see the first app of the example
 Nov 19 23:32:24 <vds>	http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking/add_instance/manage_workspace
 Nov 19 23:32:41 <jack-e>	vds: OT 2morrow in #zope3 18h ??
 Nov 19 23:32:49 <vds>	we have the form used to submit the issue
 Nov 19 23:33:03 <vds>	jack-e: ok
 Nov 19 23:33:09 <jack-e>	need sleep :)
 Nov 19 23:33:11 <jack-e>	cu
 Nov 19 23:33:14 <vds>	bye
 Nov 19 23:33:18 <--	jack-e has quit ("gone")
 Nov 19 23:33:43 <vds>	and the script
 Nov 19 23:34:25 <vds>	the form isn`t interesting we can take a look at the script
 Nov 19 23:35:40 <vds>	we use addInstance to create the instance o f a certain process definition, give it some properties and then we use startProcessInstance to make it active
 Nov 19 23:35:45 <vds>	that`s all
 Nov 19 23:35:47 <ev_>	sorry, i'm back
 Nov 19 23:36:20 <limi>	ev_: yes, we're all sorry about that ;)
 Nov 19 23:36:27 <ev_>	i'll make a log and ask vds questions later
 Nov 19 23:36:34 <ev_>	har har har
 Nov 19 23:37:14 <vds>	apps usually don`t know what`s happening just call API and use the process instance to refer application data
 Nov 19 23:38:07 <vds>	now open the hardware app please
 Nov 19 23:38:10 <vds>	http://www.reflab.it/CMFOpenflowTest/IssuesTracking/hardware/manage_workspace
 Nov 19 23:39:49 <vds>	when actors click on the link from their worklst, just as you did before, strts his task and the engine gives to the applications all the needed data 
 Nov 19 23:40:26 <vds>	so basically you can cut and paste that page and use it every time
 Nov 19 23:40:54 <vds>	quite the same for the other objects in the folder
 Nov 19 23:42:07 <vds>	as an actor click on the link he starts to work on a certain workitem (activateWorkitem)
 Nov 19 23:43:16 <vds>	the application use the process instance to store and retrive data collected during the flow but you can choose to do that creatin portal content, insert data in a RDBMS etc etc
 Nov 19 23:43:53 <vds>	when finished, the actor click on the submit button annd the python script does the rest
 Nov 19 23:44:35 -->	tesdal (~bhrsrk@vu4-en.cm.chello.no) has joined #cmfopenflow
 Nov 19 23:45:13 <vds>	as you can see the python script does something and the just complete the workitem (completeWorkitem)
 Nov 19 23:46:51 <vds>	as you can see nothing is strictly releated to the constest (the workflow situation) in the apps that can be used as skeleton for everything else or recycled for something else

request = container.REQUEST

 return workitem.actor==''

\n \n

Workitems\n \n
    \n
  • (instance_id)\n [workitem: workitem_id]\n Actor: actor name\n \n
      \n
    • Actions:\n \n Start application\n \n \n Start application\n |\n \n assign to\n \n \n assign to\n |\n \n self assign\n \n \n self assign\n |\n \n unassign\n \n \n unassign\n \n \n

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 user = request.AUTHENTICATED_USER
 
 # get wi visible to the user
 # wi inactive (todolist filter actions) 
 # wi active assigned to user (todolist filter actions)
 
 wfe = container.portal_openflow
 
 results = wfe.Catalog.searchResults(meta_type='Workitem',
 process_id=process_id,
 activity_id=activity_id,
 pull_roles=user.getRolesInContext(wfe),
 status='inactive')+\
 wfe.Catalog.searchResults(meta_type='Workitem',
 process_id=process_id,
 activity_id=activity_id,
 actor=user.getUserName(),
 status='active') 
 
 workitems = []
 for item in results:
 w = item.getObject()
 workitems.append(w)
 
 return workitems

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 user = request.AUTHENTICATED_USER
 
 wfe = container.portal_openflow
 return [r for r in user.getRolesInContext(wfe) if r in workitem.pull_roles]

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 
 wfe = container.portal_openflow
 results = wfe.Catalog.searchResults(meta_type='Process')
 
 processes = []
 for item in results:
 processes.append(item.getObject())
 
 return processes

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 user = request.AUTHENTICATED_USER
 
 
 return 0

\n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Customer:
Problem\'s Description
Possible Area:\n \n
\n
\n

Please fill the form with the correct data to submit a new issue, thanks

\n
\n \n

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 
 #try:
 
 
 oftool = container.portal_openflow
 
 instance_id = oftool.addInstance(process_id=container.pd_name, 
 customer=customer,
 comments=description,
 title="",
 activation=0)
 instance = oftool[instance_id]
 instance.manage_addProperty(id='description', value=description, type='text')
 instance.manage_addProperty(id='area', value=area, type='string')
 oftool.startInstance(instance_id=instance_id)
 RESPONSE.redirect('%s/index_html' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=Issue%20submitted%20Correctly')
 #except:
 #RESPONSE.redirect('%s/index_html' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=ERROR')

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Customer: CUSTOMER
Description: DESCRIPTION
\n Comments:\n
\n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

Please fill the form to add comments

\n \n
\n \n \n

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n
actor, comments, instance_id, workitem_id, process_id, activity_id

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 
 #try:
 oftool = container.portal_openflow
 
 oftool.activateWorkitem(instance_id=instance_id, workitem_id=workitem_id, actor=actor)
 
 instance, workitem = oftool.getInstanceAndWorkitem(instance_id, workitem_id)
 
 instance.manage_addProperty(id='activty_comments', value=comments, type='string')
 
 oftool.completeWorkitem(instance_id=instance_id, workitem_id=workitem_id)
 
 RESPONSE.redirect('%s/result' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=Issue%20assigned%20Correctly')
 #except (), e:
 #RESPONSE.redirect('%s/result' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=ERROR')

<dtml-comment>
 <dtml-sendmail smtphost="">
 From: 
 To:
 Subject:
 
 Notification body
 </dtml-sendmail>
 </dtml-comment>

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n \n
Customer: CUSTOMER
Description: DESCRIPTION
Destination Area:\n \n
\n \n \n \n \n \n
\n

Please fill the form to assign the issue to the correct area, thanks

\n \n
\n \n \n

\n \n \n \n \n \n \n
\n \n
\n \n \n
actor, area, instance_id, workitem_id, process_id, activity_id

request = container.REQUEST
 RESPONSE = request.RESPONSE
 
 #try:
 oftool = container.portal_openflow
 
 oftool.activateWorkitem(instance_id=instance_id, workitem_id=workitem_id, actor=actor)
 
 instance, workitem = oftool.getInstanceAndWorkitem(instance_id, workitem_id)
 
 instance.manage_changeProperties({'area':area})
 
 oftool.completeWorkitem(instance_id=instance_id, workitem_id=workitem_id)
 
 RESPONSE.redirect('%s/result' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=Issue%20assigned%20Correctly')
 #except (), e:
 #RESPONSE.redirect('%s/result' % context.absolute_url() + '?portal_status_message=ERROR')
